intro: Wendlandia scabra var. pilifera, commonly known as the woolly wendlandia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
